content.description: This route is 5.10 climbing to a very thin crux on hard face climbing to a great, juggy, finger crack to 5.6 finish! It is a fun line with a hard crux! It's well worth doing on TR and trying to do a head point, but I would not completely trust the pitons that are hanging on this thing. They look old and don't sound amazing. Use at your own risk.
content.protection: 2 pitons at the bottom ONLY, and a small Camalot for the crack. Although, once you hit the crack, it's pretty much over!
content.location: This is on the south face Frogman Pinnacle in Boulder Canyon!

content.description:
This route is a good introduction to squeeze chimneying for anyone trying to learn. There are numerous features outside and inside the chimney to help those without perfect technique, and this route can easily be toproped by scrambling around the backside.

On the right (East) side of the South Face is an obvious, squeeze chimney.  Work your way up the chimney utilizing stems on the face for the start until you get sucked completely into the chimney. Use the other cracks inside of the chimney and pop out on to a ledge. Walk off to the right.
content.protection: Big gear, no anchors on top, but a TR can easily be built on top of the ledge.
